content: b to the three by meaghan schmaltz the story basic brioche beanie enough said materials peepaloofields dk 100% superwash merino 231 yds / 100g 1 skein dk yarn by peepaloofields us 4 3 5mm 16 circular needle us 6 4mm 16 circular needle us 6 4mm set of double pointed needles dpns stitch markers 1 fixed 1 removable finished size 21¼ inches circumference and 9 inches tall gauge 17 sts and 24 row = 4 inches in brioche rib after blocking notes this hat is constructed in the round beginning with the brim and stitch glossary ending with the crown this pattern includes written instructions br4st decrease - brioche 4 st decrease worked over 5 sts 4 sts only decrease sl first brioche st knitwise sl next st knitwise place next brioche st on removable marker and hold in front of adjust needle size as necessary to match gauge work knit next st on lh needle pass slipped st on rh needle over 1 st decrease move st to lh needle pass next if you are new to brioche i have created a collection of how to brioche st over 1 st decrease move st to rh needle pass first brioche videos on youtube http //tinyurl com/jpenkxo slipped brioche st over 1 st decrease move st from marker to lh needle move st on rh needle to lh needle and pass held brioche sts over 1 st decrease move st back to rh needle brk - brioche knit knit the st together with its wrap brk2tog - brioche knit 2 sts together with the associated wrap on the second st 1 st decrease brp - brioche purl purl the st together with its wrap decrease - decrease d k - knit lh - left hand rem - remain s repeat - repeat rh - right hand round s - round s sl - slip_stitch sl1yo - slip 1 st with yarn in front yo st s - stitch es if you find any errors or have any questions please feel free to email me directly meaghan@unapologeticknitter com page 1 of 2 @notsorryknitter on ravelry instagram ello & twitter | unapologeticknitter com | the unapologetic knitter on facebook & youtube cast on & setup finishing using the smaller needle and the german twisted cast-on on this last round all sts will be converted to standard sts and method cast on 90 sts place a marker and join for working in the decreased at the same time round note brk2tog is not a standard brioche abbreviation tutorial http //tinyurl com/j64yl3d next round brk2tog repeat from * to end 5 sts decrease 5 sts rem setup round a *k1 sl1yo repeat from * to end setup round b *sl1yo brp 1 repeat from * to end break yarn leaving a 10-inch tail using the tapestry needle weave the tail through the live sts and cinch closed brim finishing round 1a *brk 1 sl1yo repeat from * to end round 1b *sl1yo brp 1
